text:
hey everyone welcome to Pai's kitchen today 
I am making a dish that I have been falling

in love with so much it's a dish called shakshuka 
which is super fun to say also it is so delicious

it's a dish that originated in northern Africa 
although today it's eaten in the Middle East and

it's becoming really popular in North America 
it's tomato sauce with eggs cooked right in the

tomato sauce and in North America at least it's 
a very popular breakfast brunch dish now but as I

understand it people eat this for dinner or lunch 
or any time of day it's super easy super delicious

let's get started so let's start out with the 
tomato sauce okay so I've got in this pot here

it's just some olive oil and I'm gonna turn it 
on and right away I'm gonna add my chopped onion

now when you're cooking with olive oil it's a low 
smoking point oil you don't want to get it too hot

to help the onions cook I'm gonna add some salt 
and the salt will draw out liquid from the onions

and it will help the onions soften even faster 
okay so shakshuka is not just good old tomato

sauce its tomato sauce with lots of spices and so 
I've got here some cumin seeds which is the most

important thing I've toasted this ahead of time so 
I don't have to worry about toasting it in the pot

and I've also got some coriander seeds you don't 
have to do this but I love coriander seeds so

why not right I'm gonna grind these fresh oh no so 
good already alright so that's done we'll give the

onion to stir every once in a while so the onions 
will take quite a bit of time so you don't have

to be here constantly looking at it alright so the 
onion is soft and translucent now I'm going to add

some chopped garlic and I'm adding the garlic 
after because I find garlic tends to burn more

easily if you add it at the same time some green 
bell peppers who I don't use green bell peppers

very much I feel like this is the first time I've 
ever used it on the show but I think it adds some

nice color and also flavor to this if you want 
to go red that's cool too so now we're gonna cook

that for a few more minutes all right so that 
to me looks perfect The Onion's super soft and

translucent I'm getting a little bit of browning 
around the edges of the pot to the spices are

gonna go in so the ground cumin and coriander must 
must have some paprika so this is not just regular

paprika but smoked paprika mmm some cayenne pepper 
for some heat get that stirred up because you want

the spices to really get into the oil the oil is 
your vehicle to infusing the rest of the dishes

that looks wonderful it smells even better going 
in with tomatoes so I've got here some canned

diced tomatoes if you've got whole that's totally 
fine too you just have to break it up with a spoon

and make sure it's unsalted so important look at 
that yes sound good shower it with tons and tons

of black pepper this is the consistency that 
you want it to be at the end but this is not

the end yet cuz it's got a simmer for 20 minutes 
at least so that the flavors can mingle and marry

so you need to add more water so you don't dry it 
out in the process so just a splash of water if

you're pouring directly from the can make sure 
you rinse your tomato can with this water to

get every last bit out yeah so it should be right 
now a little thinner than you want it to be don't

rush this step okay I know it looks like Oh looks 
completely done that simmering time really brings

all the flavors together oh that's so good and 
you can really smell the smoked paprika coming

through and by the way if you don't like smoked 
flavor you can just stick with regular paprika

as well it's not an absolute must now you've got 
to taste this this is definitely gonna still be a

little under salted but we want to see what we're 
at oh it's good already but yes definitely needs

a little more seasoning and do you know what I'm 
gonna do that's right I'm gonna do exactly what

do you think I am going to do I'm going to add 
some fish sauce yes before you freak out this

is anything but traditional they don't with fish 
sauce insects trigger but I mean I want to show

you the fish sauce is really a useful ingredient 
beyond Thai cuisine I mean it's just salt with a

lot of umami flavor and why would you not want to 
add that into something like this I could really

benefit from it right now I'm not using fish sauce 
that's the only seasoning as you saw I added salt

in the beginning because here I don't necessarily 
want the fish sauce flavor to be prominent but I

have found that when I make anything tomato Ian 
Stewie even lasagna like meat sauce just a dash

of fish sauce it's just like mmm it just makes 
it so much more there's there's more oomph in

it I am also going to add just a touch of sugar 
at this point what I would normally do is brown

sugar which I forgot to bring some gonna add some 
palm sugar regular sugar will be fine just a touch

and you may not need to do this it just kind 
of depends on how sweet your tomatoes and your

onions are but when you taste it and it feels just 
a little bit sharp like just a little bit mmm Hank

too tangy not well-balanced a touch of sugar is 
all you need and that is it so you can make a big

pan of shakshuka if you want that's more common 
I believe but as you know I love all things tiny

and meaning so I'm going to make a personal size 
one with this little pan this is the same pan that

I use for my type annex recipe if you haven't 
seen that it's a great recipe or the link right

up here but I have a similar thing listed in my 
kit so if you're interested in buying it online

I'll put a link right in the description below 
or what you can do is use one of these cast-iron

pans same size it's six inches the reason why I 
don't prefer this over the tapas pan is because

this retains heat really well and so there's 
quite a bit of carryover cooking even after you

turn off the heat so you know your eggs sometimes 
become overcooked so if you like your eggs runny

this can be a little risky all right let's get 
started so in here I'm gonna put in some of my

tomato sauce and I find just about a cup is enough 
turn the heat on hmm just on low if your sauce

is refrigerated you want to make sure that you 
get this hot and bubbly before you put the eggs

in make a little hole drop one in and notice I 
cracked it into a bowl ahead of time so that if I

get shells or if I have a broken yolk I don't have 
to deal with it in this sizzling bowl or bubbling

bowl at this point what I like to do see how the 
egg white is kind of on top I like to just go and

push the tomato sauce so that the egg white is on 
the bottom I find that helps the egg white cook

faster just push the tomato sauce out of the way 
allowed the egg whites to like slip under cover so

you will need some sort of a lid that fits and you 
can cook this for as long as you want depending on

how runny or how firm you like your eggs I find 
that five minutes at like a slow put-put-put kind

of bubbles work perfectly for me but if you want 
harder firmer eggs you probably want to stretch

that to maybe seven or eight minutes whew look 
at that so I'm gonna just turn this off for now

because I know it will continue to cook ever so 
slightly finishing touches sorry for a moment I

didn't know what the heck I was doing finishing 
touches so I am going to add some cilantro you

can do parsley but I always have cilantro and now 
you can top this with anything you want really

I've seen olives if you like anchovies that'll 
be really good too it'll definitely go with a

fish sauce or I love cheese I love goat cheese 
on it you can do feta cheese on it I feel like

anything that you would like on your pizza would 
be a good topping for this I'm gonna grab my toast
sourdough always get this baby on a serving plate

tada how pretty is that with some 
crusty sourdough bread of course and

for this guy right here oh yes look at that 
so because this is something that cooks from

the bottom up you're not gonna get like you're 
over easy super runny yolk because the bottom

of the yolk will naturally cook so flavorful 
I mean there's so much going on in there the

tomato sauce is full of spices and tart with 
all the little chunks of vegetables and then

you've got creamy eggs creamy cheese and 
a touch of smoked paprika with that crusty

sourdough bread and it's substantial enough 
that it would be completely satisfying for

dinner but it's not so heavy that it would be 
too much for breakfast like I think this is one

of those perfect dishes you can have breakfast 
lunch or dinner if you wanted a little heavier

you can add some meat on it some chorizo or I 
don't know put anchovies on it ham I don't know

the options are endless so when you make it send 
me a photo with such a pretty dish on Facebook

Twitter or Instagram if you haven't subscribed 
to the show make sure that you do so you don't

miss an episode and make sure you click that 
little bell icon so you get a notification

when I post a new video and the recipe will 
be on pies kitchen comm and if you love the

show you want to support us make sure to check 
out our patreon page we'll put the link in the

description below and I will see you next time for 
your next delicious infant or if your light either
